metadata.title: CVE-2023-1999 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
There exists a use after free/double free in libwebp. An attacker can usethe ApplyFiltersAndEncode() function and loop through to free best.bw andassign best = trial pointer. The second loop will then return 0 because ofan Out of memory error in VP8 encoder, the pointer is still assigned totrial and the AddressSanitizer will attempt a double free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1999` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwebp7 - 1.2.4-0.1ubuntu0.23.04.1
libwebpdemux2 - 1.2.4-0.1ubuntu0.23.04.1
libwebpmux3 - 1.2.4-0.1ubuntu0.23.04.1
webp - 1.2.4-0.1ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by new versions').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
libwebp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-0.1ubuntu0.23.04.1').
